postsData.text: I am in southwest ohio and have three 3d printers, two cnc machines. Just finished a run of ear relief clips and Faceshield holders. Does anyone need anything manufactured please let me know
postsData.post_text: I am in southwest ohio and have three 3d printers, two cnc machines. Just finished a run of ear relief clips and Faceshield holders. Does anyone need anything manufactured please let me know

postsData.text: I made two of the “medically approved” masks in the google doc. The blue one is made from reusable bags — As suggested in the tutorial that goes with the pattern. The other i made with diaper cover material from JoAnn. Thoughts on that? Tomorrow I am going to make the N95 cover “by a nurse for a nurse” because that’s what my coworkers are asking for and it’s brilliant!

postsData.text: My son is an ER nurse in Chicago and has asked me to sew him some surgical caps. Can anyone recommend a pattern appropriate for a home sewist. I have lots of fabric but no more elastic so I’m hoping to make something simple that ties behind the head. Thanks for your help.

postsData.text:
New member so I apologize in advance if this type of post isn't allowed. Our facility in MA is producing disposable face shields in big quantities (250,000 per week is our current capacity) but we need to know where they need to go. The government portals seem to be mostly unattended. We're looking to cover our manufacturing costs for large orders. Any leads would be greatly appreciated.
For anyone curious our website is https://pyxismasks.com please email or PM for bulk pricing. The amount on the website is meant for personal use.

postsData.text:
🚨UPDATE🚨 So I've briefly spoken with a chemistry professor and a material scientist about this, they both said this material might work as long as it is breathable. Since there has been feedback that it is hard to breathe through these, does anyone have Halyard H200? If you do, please try putting one layer between 100% cotton masks and see if you can easily breathe through the mask? Much appreciated!
****************************
Has anyone checked to see what's the filtration efficiency and airflow of one single layer of this type of surgical wrap (Halyard H600 FABRIC)? Want to see if this can be used as filter for a cotton mask.

ANEST.UFL.EDU
COVID-19 Mask Alternative » Department of Anesthesiology » College of Medicine » University of Florida

postsData.text:
Hello everyone, I wanted to share that we have made some big progress on a compressed gas-powered ventilation device that can be rapidly manufactured and assembled! Please reach out with any questions or comments. https://www.facebook.com/PulmoLogic/videos/2678292975734496/
PulmoLogic
April 15 at 2:01 AM ·
We're excited to demonstrate our first initiative: the rapidly manufacturable emergency ventilator ClipVent.
Here, you can see the ClipVent operating with a test lung.

postsData.text: Calling all 3D printers, injection molders, and laser cutters, and others who are manufacturing items! What tips are tricks are you using? What questions do you have that someone in the community can help out with? We’re here to help!
